content:
SyndicationFeed Class

Definition

Represents a top-level feed object, <feed> in Atom 1.0 and <rss> in RSS 2.0.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TypeForwardedFrom("System.ServiceModel.Web, Version=3.5.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35")]
public class SyndicationFeed
Inheritance
System.Object
SyndicationFeed

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0, a SyndicationFeed instance is written to a <feed> element. The following table shows how each property defined in the SyndicationFeed class is serialized to Atom 1.0.

SyndicationFeed property Serialized form
AttributeExtensions An attribute in the <feed> element for each attribute in the collection.
Authors An <author> element for each SyndicationPerson in the collection.
Categories A <category> element for each SyndicationCategory in the collection.
Contributors A <contributor> element for each SyndicationPerson in the collection.
Copyright A <rights> element.
Description A <subtitle> element.
ElementExtensions Each element in the collection is written within the <feed> element.
Generator A <generator> element.
Id An <id>element.
ImageUri A <logo> element.
Items An <entry> element for each SyndicationItem in the collection.
Language Not serialized.
LastUpdatedTime An <updated> element.
Links A <link> element for each SyndicationLink in the collection.
Title A <title> element.

When serialized to RSS 2.0, a SyndicationFeed instance is written to an <rss> element. The following table shows how each property defined in the SyndicationFeed class is serialized to RSS 2.0.

SyndicationFeed property Serialized form
AttributeExtensions An attribute in the <channel> element for each attribute in the collection.
Authors A <managingEditor> element if only one SyndicationPerson is in the collection; otherwise, an <a10:author> element for each SyndicationPerson in the collection.
Categories A <category> element for each SyndicationCategory in the collection.
Contributors An <a10:contributor> element for each SyndicationPerson in the collection.
Copyright A <copyright> element.
Description A <description> element.
ElementExtensions Each element in the collection is written within the <channel> element.
Generator A <generator> element.
Id An <a10:id> element.
ImageUri An <image> element.
Items An <item> element for each SyndicationItem in the collection.
Language A <language> element.
LastUpdatedTime A <lastBuildDate> element.
Links An <a10:link> element for each SyndicationLink in the collection.
Title A <title> element.

Constructors

SyndicationFeed()

Initializes a new instance of the SyndicationFeed class.

public SyndicationFeed ();

SyndicationFeed(IEnumerable<SyndicationItem>)

Initializes a new instance of the SyndicationFeed class with the specified collection of SyndicationItem objects.

public SyndicationFeed (System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> items);
items
IEnumerable<SyndicationItem>

A collection of SyndicationItem objects.

Remarks

The collection of SyndicationItem objects passed into this constructor is buffered.

SyndicationFeed(SyndicationFeed,Boolean)

Creates a new instance of the SyndicationFeed class with the specified feed.

protected SyndicationFeed (System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed source, bool cloneItems);
source
SyndicationFeed

The SyndicationFeed used to initialize the new instance.

cloneItems
Boolean

A value that specifies whether to clone the items in the source instance.

Remarks

If the cloneItems parameter is true, all SyndicationItem instances in the source SyndicationFeed instance are cloned and added to the Items collection of the new SyndicationFeed instance. If the cloneItems parameter is false, the Items collection of the new SyndicationFeed instance contains references to the existing SyndicationItem instances.

SyndicationFeed(String,String,Uri)

Initializes a new instance of the SyndicationFeed class with the specified title, description, and Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

public SyndicationFeed (string title, string description, Uri feedAlternateLink);
title
String

The title of the feed.

description
String

The description of the feed.

feedAlternateLink
Uri

The URI for the feed.

SyndicationFeed(String,String,Uri,IEnumerable<SyndicationItem>)

Initializes a new instance of the SyndicationFeed class with the specified title, description, URI, and collection of SyndicationItem objects.

public SyndicationFeed (string title, string description, Uri feedAlternateLink, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> items);
title
String

The title of the feed.

description
String

The description of the feed.

feedAlternateLink
Uri

The URI for the feed.

items
IEnumerable<SyndicationItem>

A collection of SyndicationItem objects.

SyndicationFeed(String,String,Uri,String,DateTimeOffset)

Creates a new instance of the SyndicationFeed class.

public SyndicationFeed (string title, string description, Uri feedAlternateLink, string id, DateTimeOffset lastUpdatedTime);
title
String

The syndication feed title.

description
String

The syndication feed description.

feedAlternateLink
Uri

The alternate URI for the syndication feed.

id
String

The ID of the syndication feed.

lastUpdatedTime
DateTimeOffset

The DateTimeOffset that contains the last time the syndication feed was updated.

SyndicationFeed(String,String,Uri,String,DateTimeOffset,IEnumerable<SyndicationItem>)

Creates a new instance of the SyndicationFeed class.

public SyndicationFeed (string title, string description, Uri feedAlternateLink, string id, DateTimeOffset lastUpdatedTime, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> items);
title
String

The syndication feed title.

description
String

The syndication feed description.

feedAlternateLink
Uri

The alternate URI for the syndication feed.

id
String

The ID of the syndication feed.

lastUpdatedTime
DateTimeOffset

The DateTimeOffset that contains the last time the syndication feed was updated.

items
IEnumerable<SyndicationItem>

A collection of SyndicationItem objects.

Properties

AttributeExtensions

Gets a collection of attribute extensions.

public System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary<System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName,string> AttributeExtensions { get; }
Value
Dictionary<XmlQualifiedName,String>

A dictionary that contains a collection of attribute extensions.

Remarks

An attribute extension is a valid XML attribute that is not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. When serialized to Atom 1.0, each custom attribute in the collection is written to the <atom> element. When serialized to RSS 2.0, each custom attribute is written to the <channel> element. For an example of adding an attribute extension, see the Loosely-Typed Extensions sample.

Authors

Gets a collection of authors of the feed.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> Authors { get; }
Value
Collection<SyndicationPerson>

A collection of SyndicationPerson objects that represents the authors of the feed.

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0, each SyndicationPerson in the collection is written to an <author> element. When serialized to RSS 2.0, if only a single SyndicationPerson exists in the collection, it is written to a <managingEditor> element. Otherwise, each SyndicationPerson is written to an <a10:author> element.

BaseUri

Gets and sets the base URI for the SyndicationFeed instance.

public Uri BaseUri { get; set; }
Value
Uri

The base URI for the SyndicationFeed instance.

Categories

Gets a collection of categories for the feed.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory> Categories { get; }
Value
Collection<SyndicationCategory>

A collection of SyndicationCategory objects that represent the categories for the feed.

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0, each SyndicationCategory in the collection is written to a <category> element.

When serialized to RSS 2.0, each SyndicationCategory in the collection is written to a <category> element.

Contributors

Gets a collection of the contributors to the feed.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson> Contributors { get; }
Value
Collection<SyndicationPerson>

A collection of SyndicationPerson objects that represents the contributors to the feed.

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0, each SyndicationPerson in the collection is written to a <contributor> element.

When serialized to RSS 2.0, each SyndicationPerson in the collection is written to an <a10:contributor> element.

Copyright

Gets and sets copyright information for the feed.

public System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent Copyright { get; set; }
Value
TextSyndicationContent

A SyndicationContent object that represents copyright information for the feed.

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0, the Copyright is written to a <rights> element.

When serialized to RSS 2.0, the Copyright is written to a <copyright> element.

Description

Gets and sets a description of the feed.

public System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent Description { get; set; }
Value
TextSyndicationContent

A TextSyndicationContent object that represents the description of the feed.

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0, Description is written to a <subtitle> element.

When serialized to RSS 2.0, Description is written to a <description> element.

ElementExtensions

Gets the element extensions for the feed.

public System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationElementExtensionCollection ElementExtensions { get; }
Value
SyndicationElementExtensionCollection

A SyndicationElementExtensionCollection instance that contains the element extensions in the feed.

Remarks

Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace.

<mg:MyElement xmlns:mg="http://myserver/elements" />

For an example of adding element extensions, see the Loosely-Typed Extensions sample.

Generator

Gets and sets the generator of the feed.

public string Generator { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the tool that generated the feed.

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0 and RSS 2.0, the Generator is written to a <generator> element.

Id

Gets and sets the ID of the feed.

public string Id { get; set; }
Value
String

The ID of the feed.

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0, the Id is written to an <id> element.

When serialized to RSS 2.0, the Id is written to an <a10:id> element.

ImageUrl

Gets and sets the image URL for the feed.

public Uri ImageUrl { get; set; }
Value
Uri

The URL for the image for the feed.

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0, the ImageUrl property is written to a <logo> element.

When serialized to RSS 2.0, the ImageUrl property is written to an <image> element.

Items

Gets a collection of the feed items contained in the feed.

public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem> Items { get; set; }
Value
IEnumerable<SyndicationItem>

A collection of SyndicationItem objects.

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0, the Items collection is written to <entry> elements.

When serialized to Atom 1.0, the Items collection is written to <item> elements.

Language

Gets and sets the language of the feed.

public string Language { get; set; }
Value
String

The name of the language the feed is written in.

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0, the Language property is written to the lang attribute in the <feed> element.

When serialized to RSS 2.0, the Language property is written to the <language> element.

LastUpdatedTime

Gets and sets the time the feed was last updated.

public DateTimeOffset LastUpdatedTime { get; set; }
Value
DateTimeOffset

A DateTimeOffset instance set to the time the feed was last updated.

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0, the LastUpdatedTime property is written to an <updated>element.

When serialized to RSS 2.0, the LastUpdatedTime property is written to a <lastBuildDate> element.

Links

Gets the links associated with the feed.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink> Links { get; }
Value
Collection<SyndicationLink>

A collection of SyndicationLink objects.

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0, the Links collection is written to a number of <link> elements.

When serialized to RSS 2.0, the Links collection is written to a number of <a10:link> elements.

Title

Gets and sets the title of the feed.

public System.ServiceModel.Syndication.TextSyndicationContent Title { get; set; }
Value
TextSyndicationContent

A TextSyndicationContent instance that contains the title of the feed.

Remarks

When serialized to Atom 1.0 and RSS 2.0, the Title property is written to a <title> element.

Methods

Clone(Boolean)

Creates a copy of the SyndicationFeed instance.

public virtual System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed Clone (bool cloneItems);
cloneItems
Boolean

A value that specifies whether the SyndicationItem objects are cloned.

Returns
SyndicationFeed

A duplicate SyndicationFeed object.

Remarks

If the cloneItems parameter is true, all items within the SyndicationFeed object are cloned; otherwise, the new SyndicationFeed instance's items collection contain references to the original SyndicationFeed instance's items.

CreateCategory()

Creates a new SyndicationCategory instance.

protected virtual System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationCategory CreateCategory ();
Returns
SyndicationCategory

A new SyndicationCategory instance.

Remarks

This method does not add the SyndicationCategory object to the Categories collection.

CreateItem()

Creates a new SyndicationItem instance.

protected virtual System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationItem CreateItem ();
Returns
SyndicationItem

A new SyndicationItem instance.

Remarks

This method does not add the SyndicationItem object to the Items collection.

CreateLink()

Creates a new SyndicationLink instance.

protected virtual System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationLink CreateLink ();
Returns
SyndicationLink

A new SyndicationLink instance.

Remarks

The new SyndicationLink instance is not added to the SyndicationFeed instance used to create it.

CreatePerson()

Creates a new SyndicationPerson instance.

protected virtual System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationPerson CreatePerson ();
Returns
SyndicationPerson

A new SyndicationPerson instance.

Remarks

This method does not add the SyndicationPerson object to the Authors or Contributors collections.

GetAtom10Formatter()

Gets an Atom10FeedFormatter instance.

public System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Atom10FeedFormatter GetAtom10Formatter ();
Returns
Atom10FeedFormatter

An Atom10FeedFormatter instance.

GetRss20Formatter()

Gets an Rss20FeedFormatter instance.

public System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20FeedFormatter GetRss20Formatter ();
Returns
Rss20FeedFormatter

An Rss20FeedFormatter instance.

GetRss20Formatter(Boolean)

Gets a new Rss20FeedFormatter instance.

public System.ServiceModel.Syndication.Rss20FeedFormatter GetRss20Formatter (bool serializeExtensionsAsAtom);
serializeExtensionsAsAtom
Boolean

A value that specifies whether to serialize element and attribute extensions with an Atom 1.0 namespace.

Returns
Rss20FeedFormatter

An Rss20FeedFormatter instance.

Remarks

The RSS 2.0 specification allows elements and attributes that are not specified in its specification only if they are within a namespace. When the serializedExtensionsAsAtom parameter is true, the formatter automatically adds the a10 namespace qualifier to all extensions; otherwise, the extensions are not serialized.

Load(XmlReader)

Loads a syndication feed from the specified XML reader.

public static System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeed Load (System.Xml.XmlReader reader);
reader
XmlReader

The XmlReader to load the feed from.

Returns
SyndicationFeed

A SyndicationFeed that contains the loaded contents.

Load<TSyndicationFeed>(XmlReader)

Loads a SyndicationFeed-derived instance from the specified XmlReader.

public static TSyndicationFeed Load<TSyndicationFeed> (System.Xml.XmlReader reader) where TSyndicationFeed : System.ServiceModel.Syndication.SyndicationFeednew();
reader
XmlReader

The XmlReader to read from.

Returns
TSyndicationFeed

A SyndicationFeed-derived instance that contains the feed.

Exceptions
XmlException

Invalid XML encountered during read.

Remarks

Use this method when you are loading a syndication item into a class derived from SyndicationFeed.

SaveAsAtom10(XmlWriter)

Write the syndication feed to the specified XmlWriter in Atom 1.0 format.

public void SaveAsAtom10 (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer);
writer
XmlWriter

The XmlWriter to write to.

SaveAsRss20(XmlWriter)

Write the syndication feed to the specified XmlWriter in RSS 2.0 format.

public void SaveAsRss20 (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer);
writer
XmlWriter

The XmlWriter to write to.

TryParseAttribute(String,String,String,String)

Attempts to parse an attribute extension.

protected virtual bool TryParseAttribute (string name, string ns, string value, string version);
name
String

The name of the element.

ns
String

The namespace of the element.

value
String

The attribute to parse.

version
String

The syndication version to use when parsing.

Returns
Boolean

A value that specifies whether the attribute extension was parsed successfully.

Exceptions
XmlException

Invalid XML Encountered during read.

Remarks

Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the <feed> (for Atom 1.0) or <rss> (for RSS 1.0) element, which depends upon the syndication version being used. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom attribute extension. To do this, you must derive a class from SyndicationFeed and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.

TryParseElement(XmlReader,String)

Attempts to parse an element extension.

protected virtual bool TryParseElement (System.Xml.XmlReader reader, string version);
reader
XmlReader

The XmlReader to read from.

version
String

The syndication version to use while parsing.

Returns
Boolean

A value that specifies whether the element extension was parsed successfully.

Exceptions
XmlException

Invalid XML encountered during read.

Remarks

Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the deserialization of a custom element extension. To do this, you must derive a class from SyndicationFeed and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.

WriteAttributeExtensions(XmlWriter,String)

Writes the attribute extensions to the specified XmlWriter using the specified syndication version.

protected virtual void WriteAttributeExtensions (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, string version);
writer
XmlWriter

The XmlReader to write to.

version
String

The syndication version to use while writing.

Remarks

Attribute extensions are custom attributes that are not defined by the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. They are serialized as an attribute of the <feed> (for Atom 1.0) or <rss> (for RSS 1.0) element, which depends upon the syndication version being used. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom attribute extensions. To do this, you must derive a class from SyndicationFeed and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized attribute extensions.

WriteElementExtensions(XmlWriter,String)

Writes the element extensions to the specified XmlWriter using the specified syndication version.

protected virtual void WriteElementExtensions (System.Xml.XmlWriter writer, string version);
writer
XmlWriter

The XmlReader to write to.

version
String

The syndication version to use while writing.

Remarks

Element extensions are valid XML elements that are not specified in either the Atom 1.0 or RSS 2.0 specifications. You can add any valid XML element as an extension, provided its namespace is different from the enclosing namespace. This method is an extension point that allows you to handle the serialization of custom element extensions. To do this, you must derive a class from SyndicationFeed and override this method. This method is called for all unrecognized element extensions.
